Beth A. Maldin and Dr. Adam S. Morgenthau were married last evening at the Tribeca Rooftop in New York. Rabbi Robert Levine officiated.

Mrs. Morgenthau, 31, is an associate at the Center for Biosecurity of the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center in Baltimore. The center seeks ways to lessen the public health impact of epidemics and biological weapons attacks. The bride does research and works with officials and legislators on policies relating to preparedness. She graduated from Emory and received a master's degree in public health from Columbia.

She is the daughter of Helaine A. Maldin and Dr. Richard A. Maldin of Easton, Conn. Her father is a podiatrist in private practice in Fairfield, Conn., and her mother is a third-grade teacher at Florence E. Blackham School in Bridgeport, Conn.

Dr. Morgenthau, 34, is a fellow in the division of pulmonary and critical care medicine at the Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine. He graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and received his medical degree from the Sackler School of Medicine at Tel Aviv University.

He is a son of Barbara Winkler of Park City, Utah, and Joel L. Morgenthau of New York, and a stepson of Laura Morgenthau. His father is a founding partner of Morgenthau & Greenes, a New York law firm. His stepmother is a managing director of Donley Communications, a public relations firm in New York.
